events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident involving their vehicle and another on the highway during rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the collision affecting the insured driverâ€™s car.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the file and contacted the policyholder shortly after.
The insurer formally acknowledged receipt of the accident claim and outlined the next steps for the customer.
The claims department requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a statement from the driver.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents, including pictures from the accident scene and the official police report.
An internal investigation was initiated to verify the facts surrounding the car accident claim and assess damages.
The investigation concluded confirming liability and verifying the extent of damage to the insured vehicle.
A settlement offer was prepared based on the evaluation of repair costs and liability from the accident.
The insured customer expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and reasonable settlement offer.
The claim was approved officially, authorizing payment for vehicle repairs as outlined in the settlement.
The insurer issued payment to the repair shop directly to cover the costs of damage caused by the accident.
Following successful payment and repair confirmation, the auto accident claim was officially closed in the system.
After closure, all documentation and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived securely.
